title: Best Cases For The OnePlus 13R
description: Get different cases across style, budget, ruggedness, and MagSafe compatibility for your OnePlus 13R phone.
author: Irene Okpanachi
excerpt: Get different cases across style, budget, ruggedness, and MagSafe compatibility for your OnePlus 13R phone.
text: Editorial Note: Talk Android may contain affiliate links on some articles. If you make a purchase through these links, we will earn a commission at no extra cost to you. Learn more. The OnePlus 13R is a new phone launched in January 2025. It's the latest in the R-series lineup, following the OnePlus 12R from January 2024. It introduces the better Snapdragon 8 Gen 3, a higher 150W charging speed, and OxygenOS 14, among other upgrades. The phone also uses the Gorilla Glass 7i material on the front and aluminum on the back. But like any other phone, it's still prone to a bad fall, and you may want to get a case to prevent damage. We've reviewed different sellers and selected the best options for you below. Related: Here Are Official Images of Potential OnePlus Open 2 Best overall Poetic Revolution rugged case $22.95 Poetic’s case brings a rugged armor design with a camera cover and kickstand. The blue color might be a little too bold for your tastes, but you can also get it in black for a lower price. The case is also quite the steal with two additional front covers and built-in screen protectors coming along with it. Best premium Covthch silicone case $9.99 The OnePlus 13R delivers flagship level performance, and should be treated with the right case. This TPU product comes with a ridged back that provides good grip, and the dark color gives your phone a premium appearance. Ease of application is one other thing to appreciate as you can quickly slip on and remove it at any time. Best budget Natbok shockproof military case $7.99 Hardly does anyone want a bulky case, which makes the Natbok TPU case perfect. It’s a cheap choice with heat management in mind, and though TPU isn’t necessarily a heatsink, it's an insulator. It'll slow heat buildup that causes your phone to overheat and misbehave. Ankusp translucent magnetic case $15.99 As more people continue to break up their entanglements with wired chargers, a magnetic case fits into the new wireless lifestyle. The Ankusp case has built-in magnets that line up accurately with MagSafe chargers, and is lightweight so that it doesn't block or slow down charging. Damondy camo case $8.99 Built like a soldier and ready to defend, the Damondy case brings a textured back that adds a rugged and tactile element. It promotes good grip and pairs nicely with the military-inspired camouflage design. The combination makes it look and feel more high-end than it actually costs. Makavo transluscent bumper case $12.99 If you don’t want a transparent case but still want to show off your OnePlus 13R’s design, get the Makavo case. It has a nice blend of translucence and a matte texture that's not too glossy and subtly shows your phone's back. Since it has a dark tone, you won’t have to worry about yellowing, which often happens with clear cases over time. Nijiadi kickstand case $9.99 Rounded edges have always been a popular design choice because they offer a more ergonomic feel and a more polished look. The OnePlus 13R has them, but the Nijiadi kickstand case makes it more pronounced. The 0.8mm height difference between the case and the screen also makes it stand out — literally. It creates a subtle but noticeable lip around the screen. When your phone falls, the glass won't make the kiss of death with the floor. Related: OnePlus Open 2 Could Be Killer Style and magnetic charging just for you You now have everything you need to protect and personalize your OnePlus 13R, with clean cutouts for accessories and side buttons. However, while some of them support magnetic wireless charging, the OnePlus 13R doesn't support the Qi2 wireless charging standard out of the box. So you won’t get the faster charging speeds that Qi2 offers, but you’ll still be able to use magnetic accessories. Irene is an experienced writer with four years in the Tech, E-commerce, and Food niches. She currently writes for Talk Android and Android Police, where she geeks out about the latest innovative practices, solutions, and gadgets. When not writing, Irene embraces her inner couch potato, finding joy in gaming, singing, music, and of course, eating. Previous Post
html:
Editorial Note: Talk Android may contain affiliate links on some articles. If you make a purchase through these links, we will earn a commission at no extra cost to you. Learn more.

The OnePlus 13R is a new phone launched in January 2025. It's the latest in the R-series lineup, following the OnePlus 12R from January 2024. It introduces the better Snapdragon 8 Gen 3, a higher 150W charging speed, and OxygenOS 14, among other upgrades.

The phone also uses the Gorilla Glass 7i material on the front and aluminum on the back. But like any other phone, it's still prone to a bad fall, and you may want to get a case to prevent damage. We've reviewed different sellers and selected the best options for you below.

Related: Here Are Official Images of Potential OnePlus Open 2

Best overall

Poetic Revolution rugged case

$22.95

Poetic’s case brings a rugged armor design with a camera cover and kickstand. The blue color might be a little too bold for your tastes, but you can also get it in black for a lower price. The case is also quite the steal with two additional front covers and built-in screen protectors coming along with it.

Best premium

Covthch silicone case

$9.99

The OnePlus 13R delivers flagship level performance, and should be treated with the right case. This TPU product comes with a ridged back that provides good grip, and the dark color gives your phone a premium appearance. Ease of application is one other thing to appreciate as you can quickly slip on and remove it at any time.

Best budget

Natbok shockproof military case

$7.99

Hardly does anyone want a bulky case, which makes the Natbok TPU case perfect. It’s a cheap choice with heat management in mind, and though TPU isn’t necessarily a heatsink, it's an insulator. It'll slow heat buildup that causes your phone to overheat and misbehave.

Ankusp translucent magnetic case

$15.99

As more people continue to break up their entanglements with wired chargers, a magnetic case fits into the new wireless lifestyle. The Ankusp case has built-in magnets that line up accurately with MagSafe chargers, and is lightweight so that it doesn't block or slow down charging.

Damondy camo case

$8.99

Built like a soldier and ready to defend, the Damondy case brings a textured back that adds a rugged and tactile element. It promotes good grip and pairs nicely with the military-inspired camouflage design. The combination makes it look and feel more high-end than it actually costs.

Makavo transluscent bumper case

$12.99

If you don’t want a transparent case but still want to show off your OnePlus 13R’s design, get the Makavo case. It has a nice blend of translucence and a matte texture that's not too glossy and subtly shows your phone's back. Since it has a dark tone, you won’t have to worry about yellowing, which often happens with clear cases over time.

Nijiadi kickstand case

$9.99

Rounded edges have always been a popular design choice because they offer a more ergonomic feel and a more polished look. The OnePlus 13R has them, but the Nijiadi kickstand case makes it more pronounced. The 0.8mm height difference between the case and the screen also makes it stand out — literally. It creates a subtle but noticeable lip around the screen. When your phone falls, the glass won't make the kiss of death with the floor.

Related: OnePlus Open 2 Could Be Killer

Style and magnetic charging just for you

You now have everything you need to protect and personalize your OnePlus 13R, with clean cutouts for accessories and side buttons. However, while some of them support magnetic wireless charging, the OnePlus 13R doesn't support the Qi2 wireless charging standard out of the box. So you won’t get the faster charging speeds that Qi2 offers, but you’ll still be able to use magnetic accessories.

Irene is an experienced writer with four years in the Tech, E-commerce, and Food niches. She currently writes for Talk Android and Android Police, where she geeks out about the latest innovative practices, solutions, and gadgets. When not writing, Irene embraces her inner couch potato, finding joy in gaming, singing, music, and of course, eating.
